WorkItem.ClosedComment:
We are closing this work item as there is a previous one portraying the same issue:
+ https://compositewpf.codeplex.com/workitem/9230

If you are interested in this issue you can a comment or post a vote in the aforementioned work item.

Thanks,

Damian Cherubini
http://blogs.southworks.net/dcherubini
WorkItem.Description:
Hi Team,

I found a bug (or may be something i am not aware) in Microsoft.Practices.Prism.Interactivity.dll. When you add this dll to your project, it disable intellesense in your xaml. so if you write something like xmlns:local=, and when you type = or press Ctrl+Space after equal, it does not show you any list. Even i tried and wait but never showed up. even if i manually type namespace and use classes, it throw compile time error that class not found in assembly. Please have a look into this. 

Vikas Dangwal
WorkItem.Summary: Bug with Prism4.1->Microsoft.Practices.Prism.Interactivity.dll. It disable intellesense in your xaml if you add this namespace

Comments.Message:
Hi Vikas,

Based on my understanding, it seems that the issue you are experiencing is related to the one reported in the following work item:- [Prism.Interactivity break IntelliSense](http://compositewpf.codeplex.com/workitem/9230)

If so, there you can find a proposed workaround that you might find useful for this problem. Also, you can post your vote in the aforementioned work item.

Regards,

Damian Cherubinihttp://blogs.southworks.net/dcherubini

Hi Damian,

Thanks for the response however i have already fixed this issue. I added System.Windows.Interactivity Dll in my project as this is a dependency dll of Microsoft.Practices.Prism.Interactivity.dll. Once i added it, it fixed my problem. 

ThanksVikas Dagnwal
